content:
Insurance Application for Watercraft Guide

The Insurance Application for Property & Casualty includes a fully functioning policy administration and claims system for marine insurance.

Product Modeling, Rating, and Business Processes

The first major task a user does in Vlocity Insurance is product modeling. The next task is creating rating procedures to price the products you've modeled, then connecting those rating procedures to your products.

We've created several product models and rating procedures to price them. In this document, we'll be using the marine product model.

Here are business processes available in the Vlocity Insurance Application for Property & Casualty:

* Quote: Users can configure, price (rate), underwrite, and present quotes to end customers.
* Issue Policy: Users can choose payment schedules and methods, enter payment information, and issue an insurance policy.
* Modify Policy (Add Endorsements/MTAs): Users can add endorsements to in-force policies.
* Cancel Policy: Users can cancel in-force policies and issue refunds to end customers as needed.

To use these features for marine insurance, request a reference org with the Property & Casualty org business app.

The product model underpins all the business processes used in the Watercraft line of business. The name of this product model is Marine.

In the Watercraft Attribute Catalog, all attributes used for the Watercraft line of business are listed by Attribute Category. Each Attribute Category has its own table, which includes attribute codes and the product specs the attributes are used by.

When we quote and endorse the Marine product, our pricing services use the product model data, product rating procedure, and pricing formulas to price the coverages, vessels, and total premium.

We've created business processes for you to examine, use as examples, and extend to create your own business processes. These include:

* Quote Business Process
* Issue Policy Business Processes
* Endorsements/MTAs for Watercraft Business Processes
* Renew Policy Business Process
* Cancel Policy Business Process

Direct Billing and Auto Pay: Policyholder, agents, and admin users can set up the option of either automatic payments for their insurance premiums or have bills sent directly to them.

One-Time Payment for Policy Premium: Policyholder and admin users can now pay monthly or quarterly premiums directly from the policy in the Lex Console.
title: Vlocity Insurance Application Guide
